text: Helen de Freitas, Lady de Freitas (16 August 1910 – 14 December 1998) was an American-born British public servant, and "a leading member of the American community in London". She was born Helen Graham Bell in Chicago, Illinois on 16 August 1910, the eldest of four daughters of Laird Bell, an American lawyer, who was chairman of the Chicago Council on Foreign Relations. She grew up in Winnetka, Illinois, and graduated from Bryn Mawr in 1936. In 1938, she married the British politician and diplomat Sir Geoffrey de Freitas, and they have three sons, and one daughter. She died in London on 14 December 1998. ==References== Category:1910 births Category:1998 deaths Category:American expatriates in Ghana Category:American expatriates in Kenya Category:British expatriates in Ghana Category:British expatriates in Kenya Category:Bryn Mawr College alumni Category:American emigrants to the United Kingdom
title: Helen de Freitas
